<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">across many industries, with financial services and residential real estate being particularly hard hit.&#160;&#160;Covenant Bank, with a loan portfolio consisting primarily of loans secured by single family residences has seen a rapid and precipitous decline in the value of the collateral securing its loan portfolio and a sharp decrease in the Bank&#8217;s capital<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">, and as a result, no assurances can be made </font>about the Company&#8217;s ability to continue as a going concern.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">This annual report on Form 10-K includes the Company&#8217;s audited financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2010; however, the Company&#8217;s audited financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2011 are not complete.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, set forth below are certain unaudited financial results as of and for the year ended December 31, 2011 as compared to audited results as of and for the year ended December 31, 2010.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2011, the Company&#8217;s total assets were $63.5 million as compared to $68.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2010.&#160;&#160;Loans, net of allowance for loan losses was $43.7 million as of December 31, 2011 as compared to $52.8 million as of December 31, 2010.&#160;&#160;Nonperforming assets, including OREO were $6.6&#160;million as of December 31, 2011 as compared to $4.8&#160;million as of December 31, 2010.&#160;&#160;Net interest income was $2.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2011 as compared to $2.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2010.&#160;&#160;Net loss for the year ended December 31, 2011 was $1.8 million as compared to a net loss of $1.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2010.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">As of March 31, 2012, the Company&#8217;s total assets were $61.1 million.&#160;&#160;Loans, net of allowance for loan losses was $41.8 million as of March 31, 2012.&#160;&#160;Nonperforming assets, including OREO were $7.5 million as of March 31, 2012.&#160;&#160;Net interest income was $0.5 million for the period ended March 31, 2012.&#160;&#160;Net loss for the period ended March 31, 2012 was $0.3 million.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">As previously disclosed, the Bank, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (the &#8220;FDIC&#8221;) and the Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (the &#8220;IDFPR&#8221;) entered into a final joint Consent Order (the &#8220;Order&#8221;) on June 6, 2011.&#160;&#160;The Order requires the Bank to achieve and maintain minimum regulatory capital levels in excess of the statutory minimums to be classified as well-capitalized, and require the Bank to develop a liquidity risk management and contingency funding plan.&#160;&#160;In particular, the Order contained a requirement that the Bank to develop capital plans.&#160;&#160;Under the Order, the Bank is prohibited from paying any dividends without, among other things, prior FDIC or IDFPR approval.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Pursuant to the Order, among other things, the Bank has agreed to achieve and maintain a Tier&#160;1 leverage capital to total assets ratio of at least 9% and a total risk-based capital ratio of at least 13%.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2011, the Bank&#8217;s Tier 1 leverage capital to total assets ratio was 4.43% as compared to 4.81% as of December 31, 2010, and the total risk-based capital ratio was 8.32% as of December 31, 2011 as compared to 9.37% as of December 31, 2010.&#160;&#160;As of March 31, 2012, such ratios were 3.91% and 7.57%, respectively, causing the Bank to be designated as undercapitalized under the interagency capital adequacy guidelines.&#160;&#160;These capital levels are also less than those specified in the Order, causing the Bank to be in noncompliance with the Order.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Any material failure to comply with the provisions of the Order, including a failure to achieve the capital ratios required by the Order, could result in additional enforcement actions by the FDIC as allowed by 12 U.S.C. &#167;1818<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">.&#160;&#160;The continued erosion of capital at </font>the Bank could <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">result in the Bank being </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">placed into FDIC receivership by its regulators, or <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">a sale of the Company to </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">a third party in a transaction in which the Company receives no value for its interest in the Bank<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">.&#160;&#160;Either&#160;</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">of&#160;these events would be expected to result in a loss of all or a substantial portion of the value of the Company&#8217;s outstanding securities.&#160;&#160;&#160;There can be no assurance that the Bank will be able to comply fully with the provisions of the Order, or that efforts to comply with the</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">3</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Order will not have adverse effects on the results of operations and financial condition of the Company and the Bank.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company began active operations when it acquired its sole subsidiary, Community Bank of Lawndale, now known as Covenant Bank, on March&#160;12, 2008.&#160;&#160;Since 2009, the Company has issued $1,268,500 of senior convertible debt.&#160;&#160;In 2010, $593,075 of this debt and the related accrued interest of $23,320 was converted to 75,678 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock.&#160;&#160;As of March&#160;31, 2012, $675,425 of this senior convertible debt remains outstanding.&#160;&#160;Beginning in April&#160;2011, the Company sold shares of series&#160;A preferred stock and as of March&#160;31, 2012, $575,000 was issued and outstanding.&#160;&#160;Most of the proceeds from the issuance of these securities was injected into the Bank in order to increase its capital position.&#160;&#160;Since beginning operations with the purchase of the Bank in March 2008, the Company has accumulated approximately $6.2 million in net losses through March 31, 2012.&#160;&#160;To the extent that the current conditions in the housing market and the general economy continue or worsen, the Company believes that the level of problem assets and losses is likely to increase, which could result in Covenant Bank being placed into receivership.&#160;&#160;Because the Bank is the only asset of the Company, such an occurrence could render the securities of the Company worthless.</font></font></font></div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160;</font></div>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">In addition to the Company&#8217;s financial challenges, its management and Board of Directors has changed since December 2010.&#160;&#160;In December, 2010, John Sorensen, the President and CEO of the Company and Senior Loan Officer of Covenant Bank, resigned to pursue other opportunities.&#160;&#160;Dr.&#160;William (Bill) Winston, the Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Company served as interim CEO of the Bank from December 2010 until January&#160;3, 2012 when Belinda Whitfield, a Director of the Company and the Bank was appointed by the Board of Directors to act as the Bank&#8217;s interim President and CEO until a permanent CEO can be hired.&#160;&#160;It should be noted that Belinda Whitfield&#8217;s role is subject to review by the FDIC on June&#160;30, 2012.&#160;&#160;Addie Husbands, a director of the Company and the Bank since September 2010, resigned from the both Boards on February 29, 2012.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Because the Bank&#8217;s loan portfolio is concentrated in loans secured by single family rental property loans, the Bank&#8217;s asset quality is significantly impacted by the continued weakening of the housing market and the general economy.&#160;&#160;This has contributed to increased levels of nonperforming assets, charge-offs, and credit loss reserves.&#160;&#160;As a result, the Company reported a net loss of $1.1 million for the year ended December&#160;31, 2010, compared to a net loss of $1.8 million for the year ended December&#160;31, 2009 and a net loss of $1.2 million for the period from inception, March&#160;12, 2008, to December&#160;31, 2008.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">In summary, we are experiencing significant loan quality issues.&#160;&#160;The impact of the downturn of the economy in the U.S. as well as in the communities we serve is having far-reaching consequences making it difficult to assess when the operating environment for the Bank will improve, if at all.&#160;&#160;The Bank&#8217;s loan portfolio continues to deteriorate, resulting in significant loan losses.&#160; These loan losses have caused capital levels to decline sharply.&#160; The Bank<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#8217;</font>s capital may not be sufficient to offset future losses.&#160;&#160;As a result, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">no assurances can be made about the Company&#8217;s</font> continued viability.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Covenant Bank</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Bank was established in 1977 and has its headquarters in the west-side Chicago neighborhood of North Lawndale.&#160;&#160;The Bank also leases property at 7306 W. Madison Street, Forest Park, Illinois 60130.&#160;&#160;As of December&#160;31, 2010, the Bank had 28 full-time equivalent employees.&#160;&#160;The total assets of the Bank were approximately $68.3 million and $71.6 million as of December&#160;31, 2010 and 2009, respectively.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company&#8217;s mission is to promote economic development and opportunity in the communities the Bank serves by offering high-quality financial products and services.&#160;&#160;The Company considers the greater Chicago, Illinois metropolitan area as its primary market area, although, most of the Bank&#8217;s customers reside in the west-side Chicago neighborhood of North Lawndale, and focuses its business on serving minority populations and those who have not traditionally had relationships with financial institutions.&#160;&#160;As minority-owned institutions, the Bank and the Company are designated by the</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">4</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">U.S. Treasury as community development financial institutions and anticipate maintaining these designations.&#160;&#160;Because of its designation as a community development financial institution, the Bank may earn Bank Enterprise Awards for lending activity in economically distressed communities.&#160;&#160;The Company earned $430,000 in awards during 2009, based on 2008 activity, and was awarded $600,000 in 2010 based on 2009 lending activity.&#160;&#160;The Bank has also applied to the U.S. Treasury for additional grants to increase lending to businesses and homeowners in these economically distressed communities.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Our primary business activity is the origination of one- to four family and multi-family real estate loans (both owner occupied and non-owner occupied investment properties).&#160;&#160;To a lesser extent, we originate business loans.&#160;&#160;We also invest in securities, primarily United States Government Agency securities and mortgage-backed securities.&#160;&#160;Since the purchase of Community Bank of Lawndale, we have utilized wholesale funding sources to help fund our operations.&#160;&#160;During the year ended December&#160;31, 2010, the Company&#8217;s goal was to reduce losses and the volume of problem loans, and concentrate on operations and maintain our market share.&#160;&#160;During 2010, we reduced the dollar size of loans and restricted multiple credits to individual borrowers.&#160;&#160;We believe that these measures will improve the credit quality of the Bank&#8217;s portfolio.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Employees</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">As of December&#160;31, 2010, the Company and its subsidiary had 26 full-time employees and 3 part-time employees, which together equate to 28 full-time-equivalent employees.&#160;&#160;None of the employees are represented by a collective bargaining group.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Business Strategy</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The immediate strategy of the Bank is to stabilize its condition by focusing on the collection of the Bank&#8217;s problem loans.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Bank has sought to control expenses.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company&#8217;s longer term business strategy is to operate a well-capitalized and profitable community bank while promoting economic development and opportunity in the community.&#160;&#160;After the initial acquisition of the Community Bank of Lawndale, a management team was established to execute the Company&#8217;s long-term business strategy.&#160;&#160;To provide a stream of income, the Company purchased seasoned loans from other financial institutions, and funded the purchase of these loans with brokered deposits.&#160;&#160;The following are the key aspects of the Company&#8217;s business strategy.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Core Lending Strategy.</font>&#160;&#160;The Company, through its officers and staff, works to attract core deposits from local markets by offering competitive rate and fee structures and a high level of service and by marketing the Bank to consumers through multiple channels.&#160;&#160;The Bank has maintained a strong presence in its immediate West Side Chicago community, with a deposit share of over 75%.&#160;&#160;The Bank also maintains a loan production office in Forest Park, Illinois.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company&#8217;s lending philosophy is to provide a full-service lending and deposit relationship to each customer.&#160;&#160;Part of the lending focus is on small- to medium-sized, owner-operated businesses.&#160;&#160;After entering into a lending relationship, the Company seeks to expand the relationship through extensive cross-selling efforts to the business owners, their families, associates and employees, including special loan programs, direct payroll deposits, special deposit packages and customized service programs.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Since the acquisition of the Bank in 2008, the Company&#8217;s New Business Development Officer and Residential Mortgage Representatives have focused marketing efforts in low- to moderate-income communities and have developed working relationships with community organizations whose missions include community development.&#160;&#160;These community organizations include:&#160;&#160;Chicago Community Ventures; Chicago Urban League; Community Investment Corporation; Community Reinvestment Organizing Project; Englewood Black Chamber of Commerce; Greater North West Chicago Industrial</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">5</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">League; Hull House-Parkway Community House; Lawndale Business Development Corporation; Lawndale Christian Development Corporation; Neighborhood Housing Services; Nobel Neighbors; North Lawndale Chamber of Commerce; West Humboldt Park Family Community Development Corporation; and Quad City Developers.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the Board of Directors is encouraged to engage with many community groups in volunteer leadership roles in order to build awareness of the Bank.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">While the Company has pursued these strategies, the nationwide economic crisis beginning in 2008 has had an impact on the credit quality of the loan portfolio.&#160;&#160;The Company had significant loan loss provisions and non-performing assets that were the primary cause for the Company&#8217;s net loss in 2010.&#160;&#160;In addition, in 2009 the Company determined goodwill was fully impaired, which resulted in a charge of $1,186,000.<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>Goodwill represents the excess of cost over fair value of net assets acquired which arose in the acquisition of Community Bank of Lawndale during March 2008.&#160;&#160;The Company believes it has identified and accounted for its problems over the past three years, and is working to position itself for improvement as the economy recovers; however, no assurances can be made that such efforts will be successful.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Operating Strategy.</font>&#160;&#160;The Company offers products and services, such as internet banking with bill pay, service-charge-free checking, remote deposit capture, account analysis statements, electronic bank statements, and telephone banking, similar to those offered by larger financial institutions.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company is geared toward building banking relationships with its customers, as opposed to processing individual transactions.&#160;&#160;The Company focuses on attracting and retaining customers to promote cross-selling activities and to decrease acquisition costs.&#160;&#160;As a small community bank, the Company emphasizes its service level to create an environment in which the customer is the most important element of the business.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that a high degree of personal service is one of the important competitive advantages of smaller banks.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Bank works closely with small businesses, including small businesses owned by African Americans, Hispanics and women.&#160;&#160;The Bank offers complete banking services to these businesses, including start-up businesses.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company intends to maintain a strong commitment to community banking.&#160;&#160;The Company has formed an advisory board, which is composed of members who are active in community development.&#160;&#160;The Bank has worked with The Joseph Center, an affiliate of the Living Word Christian Center, which provides training for business owners and managers.&#160;&#160;The Company has also conducted classes concerning financial literacy, home ownership, business ownership and other subjects designed to promote economic development.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Market Area</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company is primarily focused on Chicago and western Cook County.&#160;&#160;The Bank is located in the North Lawndale neighborhood of Chicago, Illinois, approximately six&#160;miles from the center of the Chicago business district.&#160;&#160;The North Lawndale community encompasses an area slightly larger than 3 square&#160;miles on Chicago&#8217;s west side.&#160;&#160;The community has seen its population drop from 125,000 in 1960 to 42,000 in 2000, with a decrease of 9,000 between 1990 and 2000, as large employers, including Sears and International Harvestor, have left the area.&#160;&#160;As a way to diversify its loan concentration, the Bank has marketed it loan products to the whole city of Chicago.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">As the Company has accumulated 76% of the local deposits according to the FDIC&#8217;s Summary of Deposits (&#8220;SOD&#8221;), the Company has looked beyond its neighborhood for funding its operations.&#160;&#160;The Company has recently established an office of the Bank in Forest Park, Illinois.&#160;&#160;Currently, the Forest Park office serves as a loan production office.&#160;&#160;The Company is evaluating opening a branch at this site.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">6</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The establishment of such a branch would be subject to applications to and approvals by both the IDFPR and FDIC.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company&#8217;s share of the 60624 zip code market at 76% is the largest of the 5 FDIC-insured institutions located in that market.&#160;&#160;The source of the deposit data and corresponding market shares is the FDIC SOD web link.&#160;&#160;The SOD contains deposit data for all branches and offices of FDIC-insured institutions.&#160;&#160;The FDIC collects deposit balances for commercial and savings banks as of June&#160;30 of each year.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Competition</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company does business in the highly competitive financial services industry and competes against large national banks, other commercial and community banks, savings institutions, credit unions, mortgage banking firms, consumer finance companies, securities brokerage firms, insurance companies, money market mutual funds and other financial institutions operating within the market.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s non-bank competitors may not be subject to the same degree of regulation as that imposed on FDIC-insured banks and Illinois-chartered banks.&#160;&#160;As a result, such non-bank competitors may have advantages over the Bank in providing certain services.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company has addressed these competitive challenges through its business strategy and by maintaining an independent community bank presence with local decision-making.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the Company and the Bank will continue to compete for qualified personnel by offering competitive levels of compensation.&#160;&#160;The Company believes attracting and retaining high-quality employees is important in enabling the Bank to compete effectively for market share with both its large and small competitors.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Products and Services</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">General.</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>The Company, through its subsidiary, conducts a full-service consumer and commercial banking business, which includes mainly deposit gathering, safekeeping and distribution; lending for commercial purposes and real estate purposes (including construction and mortgages) and consumer purposes.&#160;&#160;These products and services are provided in the Company&#8217;s market through its main office and loan production office.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Lending Activities.</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>The Company&#8217;s objective is to offer the commercial and residential customers in its market a variety of products and services, including a full array of loan products.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s bank subsidiary makes real estate loans (including construction and mortgage loans), commercial loans and consumer loans.&#160;&#160;The Company strives to do business in the area served by its bank and all of the Company&#8217;s marketing efforts, and the vast majority of its loan customers are located within its existing market area.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Bank tries to reduce its interest rate risk by making its loan portfolio more interest rate sensitive.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, the Bank offers adjustable rate mortgage loans and short- and medium-term mortgage loans.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Bank offers shorter-term consumer loans.&#160;&#160;Lending activities are subject to a variety of lending limits imposed by state and federal law.&#160;&#160;Illinois law generally requires that loans to an individual may not exceed in the aggregate 25 percent of a bank&#8217;s capital and surplus.&#160;&#160;Federal law imposes a lower lending limit on loans to executive officers, directors, principal shareholders and the related interests of all such persons, and also requires that such loans not be preferential.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">At December&#160;31, 2010, the Company had no sub-prime or Alt-A loans.&#160;&#160;The Company has no intention of offering sub-prime products.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The following is a discussion of each major type of lending.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">7</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Real Estate Loans.</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>The Bank makes real estate loans for construction and mortgage purposes as more thoroughly described below.&#160;&#160;Collectively, these loans comprise the largest category of the Company&#8217;s loans.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2010, the Company had approximately $53.6 in such loans, representing 98.3% of total loans.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2009, the Company had approximately $55.3 in such loans, representing 97.3% of total loans.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Construction Real Estate Loans</font>.&#160;&#160;The Bank also makes loans to finance the re-habilitation of existing residential and non-residential properties.&#160;&#160;Construction loans generally are secured by first liens on real estate.&#160;&#160;The Bank conducts periodic inspections, either directly or through an agent, prior to approval of periodic draws on these loans.&#160;&#160;Construction loans involve additional risks attributable to the fact that loan funds are advanced upon the security of a project under construction, and the project is of uncertain value prior to its completion.&#160;&#160;Due to uncertainties inherent is estimating construction costs, the market value of the completed project and the effects of governmental regulation on real property, it can be difficult to accurately evaluate the total funds required to complete a project and the related loan-to-value ratio.&#160;&#160;As a result of these uncertainties, construction lending often involves the disbursement of substantial funds with repayment dependent, in part, on the success of the ultimate project rather than the ability of a borrower or guarantor to repay the loan.&#160;&#160;If a bank is forced to foreclose on a project prior to completion, there is no assurance that the bank will be able to recover all of the unpaid portion of the loan.&#160;&#160;In addition, the bank may be required to fund additional amounts to complete a project and may have to hold the property for an indeterminate period of time.&#160;&#160;While the Bank has underwriting procedures designed to identify what management believes to be acceptable levels of risk in construction lending, these procedures may not prevent losses from the risks described above.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Bank secures a valid lien on construction real estate loans and obtains a mortgage title insurance policy that insures that the property is free of encumbrances prior to the Bank lien.&#160;&#160;The Bank requires hazard insurance, insurance bonding on a contractor, and if the property is in a flood plain as designated by FEMA or HUD, the Bank requires flood insurance.&#160;&#160;Typically, the Company requires full investment of the borrower&#8217;s equity in construction projects prior to injecting funds.&#160;&#160;Generally, the Bank does not allow borrowers to recoup equity from the sale proceeds of finished product (if applicable) until the Bank has recovered all funds.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Construction real estate loans have generated the following approximate dollar amounts and represented the following percentages of the Company&#8217;s consolidated revenues for the years indicated:&#160;&#160;$197,000 or 4.2% for 2010, $171,000 or 4.1% for 2009, and less than 0.1% for 2008.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2010, the Company had $1.8 million in such loans, representing 3.2% of total loans.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2009, the Company had $3.1 million in such loans, representing 5.5% of total loans.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Residential and Commercial Real Estate Loans</font>.&#160;&#160;A significant portion of the Company&#8217;s lending activity consists of the origination of mortgage loans collateralized by properties located in the Company&#8217;s market area.&#160;&#160;The Bank offers a variety of residential mortgage loan products that generally amortize over five to thirty years.&#160;&#160;Residential loans collateralized by mortgage real estate generally have been originated in amounts of no more than 80% of the lower of cost or appraised value or the Bank requires private mortgage insurance.&#160;&#160;The Bank has retained all of its loan origination in its portfolio.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Bank offers a variety of commercial real estate mortgage loan products that generally are amortized up to thirty years.&#160;&#160;The rates on these loans usually range from a daily variable rate to a fixed rate for no more than five years.&#160;&#160;The commercial real estate mortgage loans are collateralized by owner/operator real estate mortgages, as well as investment real estate mortgages.&#160;&#160;Loans collateralized by commercial real estate mortgages are generally originated in amounts of no more than 75% of the lower of cost or appraised value.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">8</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Bank secures a valid lien on mortgage real estate loans and obtains a mortgage title insurance policy that insures the property is free of encumbrances prior to the Bank&#8217;s lien.&#160;&#160;The Bank requires hazard insurance in the amount of the loan and, if the property is in a flood plain as designated by FEMA or HUD, the Bank requires flood insurance.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Residential real estate loans have generated the following approximate dollar amounts and represented the following percentages of the Company&#8217;s consolidated revenues for the years indicated:&#160;&#160;$3.0 million or 64.4% for 2010, $2.4 million or 57.8% for 2009, and $568,000 or 29.6% for 2008.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2010, the Company had $43.2 million in such loans, representing 79.3% of total loans.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2009, the Company had $43.1 million in such loans, representing 75.9% of total loans.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Residential real estate loans are the largest loan category on the balance sheet.&#160;&#160;Of the $43.3 million in residential real estate loans at December&#160;31, 2010, multi-family (5 or more units) loans accounted for $17.4 million, or 40.3%, non-owner occupied 1-4 family real estate comprised $18.4 million, or 42.6%, and owner occupied 1-4 family real estate comprised $7.4 million, or 17.1%.&#160;&#160;Of the $43.1 million in residential real estate loans at December&#160;31, 2009, multi-family (5 or more units) loans accounted for $20.1 million, or 46.5%, non-owner occupied 1-4 family real estate comprised $14.8 million, or 34.3%, and owner occupied 1-4 family real estate comprised $8.3 million, or 19.2%.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Commercial real estate loans have generated the following approximate dollar amounts and represented the following percentages of the Company&#8217;s consolidated revenues for the years indicated:&#160;&#160;$485,000 or 10.4% for 2010, $482,000 or 11.5% for 2009, and $24,000 or 1.3% for 2008.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2010, the Company had $8.6 million in such loans, representing 15.8% of total loans.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2009, the Company had $9.1 million in such loans, representing 16.0% of total loans.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The most significant risk concerning mortgage real estate loans is the fluctuation in market value of the real estate collateralizing the loans.&#160;&#160;A decrease in market value of real estate securing a loan may jeopardize the Bank&#8217;s ability to recover all of the unpaid portion of the loan if the Bank is forced to foreclose.&#160;&#160;If there were significant decreases in market value throughout the Company&#8217;s market, the Company could experience multiple losses.&#160;&#160;While the Bank has underwriting procedures designed to identify what management believes to be acceptable lender risks in mortgage lending, these procedures may not prevent losses from the risks described above.&#160;&#160;It is not the Company&#8217;s practice to make subprime loans.&#160;&#160;Approximately 94.0% of all of the Company&#8217;s net charge-offs for the years 2008 through 2010 were related to loans secured by real estate.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Commercial Loans</font>.&#160;&#160;These loans are primarily made within the Company&#8217;s market area and are underwritten on the basis of the borrower&#8217;s ability to service the debt from income.&#160;&#160;The Company is an approved Small Business Administration (&#8220;SBA&#8221;) 750 lender.&#160;&#160;As a general practice, the Bank takes as collateral a lien on any available equipment, accounts receivable or other assets owned by the borrower and often obtains the personal guaranty of the borrower.&#160;&#160;In general, these loans involve more credit risk than residential mortgage loans and commercial mortgage loans and, therefore, usually yield a higher return.&#160;&#160;The increased risk in commercial loans is due to the type of collateral securing these loans.&#160;&#160;The increased risk also derives from the expectation that the loan generally will be serviced principally from the operations of the business, and those operations may not be successful.&#160;&#160;As a result of these additional complexities, variables and risks, commercial loans require more thorough underwriting and servicing than other types of loans.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Commercial loans have generated the following approximate dollar amounts and represented the following percentages of the Company&#8217;s consolidated revenues for the years indicated:&#160;&#160;$54,000 or 1.1% for 2010, $79,000 or 1.9% for 2009, and $215,000 or 11.2% for 2008.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2010, the Company had $383,000 in such loans, representing 0.7% of total loans.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2009, the Company had $987,000 in such loans, representing 1.7% of total loans.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">9</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Consumer Loans</font>.&#160;&#160;The Company provides a variety of consumer loans (also referred to in this report as installment loans to individuals) including motor vehicle, personal (collateralized and non-collateralized) and deposit account collateralized loans.&#160;&#160;The terms of these loans typically range from 12 to 72 months and vary based upon the nature of collateral and size of loan.&#160;&#160;Consumer loans entail greater risk than do residential mortgage loans, particularly in the case of consumer loans that are unsecured or secured by rapidly depreciating assets such as automobiles.&#160;&#160;In such cases, any repossessed collateral for a defaulted consumer loan may not provide an adequate source of repayment for the outstanding loan balance.&#160;&#160;The remaining deficiency often does not warrant further substantial collection efforts against the borrower beyond obtaining a deficiency judgment.&#160;&#160;In addition, consumer loan collections are dependent on the borrower&#8217;s continuing financial stability, and thus are more likely to be affected by job loss, divorce, illness or personal bankruptcy.&#160;&#160;Furthermore, the application of various federal and state laws may limit the amount that can be recovered on such loans.&#160;&#160;Approximately 6.0% of all of the Company&#8217;s net charge-offs for the years 2008 through 2010 were related to commercial loans.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Consumer loans have generated the following approximate dollar amounts and represented the following percentages of the Company&#8217;s consolidated revenues for the years indicated:&#160;&#160;$20,000 or 0.4% for 2010, $29,000 or 0.7% for 2009, and $20,000 or 1.0% for 2008.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2010, the Company had $539,000 in such loans, representing 1.0 % of total loans.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2009, the Company had $552,000 in such loans, representing 1.0% of total loans.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Underwriting Strategy</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company&#8217;s lending activities reflect an underwriting strategy that emphasizes asset quality and fiscal prudence in order to keep capital resources available for the most attractive lending opportunities in the Company&#8217;s market.&#160;&#160;All loan requests are approved by the Bank&#8217;s loan committee.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s strategy for approving or disapproving loans is to follow conservative loan policies and underwriting practices, which include:</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25;">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">granting loans on a sound and collectible basis;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25;">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">investing funds properly for the benefit of the Company&#8217;s shareholders and the protection of its depositors;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25;">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">serving the legitimate needs of the community in the Company&#8217;s market while maintaining a balance between maximum yield and minimum risk;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25;">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">ensuring that primary and secondary sources of repayment are adequate in relation to the amount of the loan;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25;">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">developing and maintaining adequate diversification of the loan portfolio as a whole and of the loans within each category; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25;">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">ensuring that each loan is properly documented and, if appropriate, insurance coverage is adequate.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s loan review personnel and compliance officer interact on a regular basis with commercial, mortgage and consumer lenders to identify potential underwriting or technical exception variances.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">In addition, the Company has placed increased emphasis on the early identification of problem loans to aggressively seek resolution of the situation and thereby keep loan losses at a minimum.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The following table sets forth the composition of the Company&#8217;s loan portfolio:</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

</td>
<td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160;</font></td>

</div>

</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Maturity of Loan Portfolio.&#160;&#160;</font>The following table presents certain information at December&#160;31, 2010 regarding the dollar amount of loans, before net items, maturing in the portfolio based on contractual terms to maturity or scheduled amortization, however, does not include potential prepayments.&#160;&#160;Scheduled contractual maturities of loans do not necessarily reflect the actual expected term of the loan portfolio.&#160;&#160;The average life of mortgage loans is substantially less than their average contractual terms because of prepayments.&#160;&#160;The average life of mortgage loans tends to increase when current mortgage loan rates are higher than rates on existing mortgage loans and, conversely, it tends to decrease when rates on current mortgage loans are lower than existing mortgage loan rates (due to prepayments as a result of the refinancing of adjustable-rate and fixed-rate loans at lower rates).&#160;&#160;Loan balances do not include undisbursed loan proceeds or the allowance for loan losses.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">11</font></div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Non-Performing Loans.</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>A loan is non-performing when it is more than ninety days past due.&#160;&#160;Specific allocations are made for loans that are determined to be non-performing.&#160;&#160;Loans past due less than ninety days may also be classified as non-performing when management does not expect to collect all amounts due according to the contractual terms of the loan agreement.&#160;&#160;Specific allocations are measured by determining the present value of expected future cash flows or, for collateral-dependent loans, the fair value of the collateral adjusted for market conditions and selling expenses as compared to the loan carrying value.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The loan loss allowance as a percentage of nonperforming loans was 35.5% at December&#160;31, 2010 compared to 47.8% at December&#160;31, 2009.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Potential Problem Loans</font>.&#160;&#160;Potential problem loans consist of loans that are performing in accordance with contractual terms but for which management has concerns about the ability of an obligor</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">12</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">to continue to comply with repayment terms because of the obligor&#8217;s potential operating or financial difficulties.&#160;&#160;Management monitors these loans closely and reviews their performance on a regular basis.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Analysis of Allowance for Loan Losses</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Company has established an allowance for loan losses to provide for those loans that may not be repaid in their entirety.&#160;&#160;The allowance for loan losses is currently maintained at a level considered by management to be adequate to provide for probable loan losses.&#160;&#160;The allowance is increased by provisions charged to earnings and is reduced by charge-offs, net of recoveries.&#160;&#160;The provision for loan losses is based on management&#8217;s evaluation of the loan portfolio under current economic conditions.&#160;&#160;Loans are charged to the allowance for loan losses when, and to the extent, they are deemed by management to be uncollectible.&#160;&#160;The allowance for loan losses is composed of allocations for specific loans and a general reserve for all other loans.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The following table sets forth loans charged off and recovered and an analysis of the allowance for loan losses for the years ended December&#160;31, 2010 and 2009.</font></div>
