<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Note 1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Business:</font>&#160;&#160;Covenant Bancshares, Inc. (the Company) is the bank holding company for Covenant Bank (the Bank), a wholly owned subsidiary.&#160;&#160;The Bank provides a full range of financial services to individual customers and small business customers through its offices in Cook County, Illinois.&#160;&#160;The Company and the Bank are subject to regulations of certain federal and state regulatory agencies and undergo periodic examinations by these agencies.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Basis of financial statement presentation:</font>&#160;&#160;The consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States and include the accounts and operations of the Company and the Bank.&#160;&#160;All significant intercompany accounts and transactions have been eliminated in consolidation.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Use of estimates:</font>&#160;&#160;In preparing the consolidated financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America, management is required to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities as of the date of the balance sheet and reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period.&#160;&#160;Actual results could differ from those estimates.&#160;&#160;Material estimates that are particularly susceptible to significant change in the near term relate to the determination of the allowance for loan losses and the valuation of deferred tax assets.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Presentation of cash flows:</font>&#160;&#160;Cash flows from federal funds sold, interest-bearing deposit in banks, loans originated by the Bank and deposits are reported net.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Interest-bearing deposits in banks:</font>&#160;&#160;Interest-bearing deposits in banks mature within one year and are carried at cost.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Securities:</font>&#160;&#160;Debt securities are classified as held to maturity and carried at amortized cost when management has the positive intent to hold them to maturity.&#160;&#160;Debt securities are classified as available for sale when they might be sold before maturity.&#160;&#160;Securities available for sale are carried at fair value, with unrealized holding gains and losses net of tax, reported as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income in stockholders&#8217; equity.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Purchase premiums and discounts are recognized in interest income using the interest method over the terms of the securities.&#160;&#160;Gains and losses on the sale of securities are recorded on the trade date and are determined using the specific identification method.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Declines in the fair value of individual available for sale securities below their amortized cost basis that are deemed to be other-than-temporary impairment losses are reflected as realized losses.&#160;&#160;In determining whether other-than-temporary impairment exists, management considers many factors, including (1)&#160;the length of time and the extent to which the fair value has been less than cost; (2)&#160;the financial condition and near-term prospects of the issuer; (3)&#160;the current liquidity and volatility of the market for each of the individual security categories; (4)&#160;the projected cash flows from the specific security type; (5)&#160;the financial guarantee and financial rating of the issuer; (6)&#160;if the Company intends to sell the security; and (7)&#160;if it is more likely than not that the Company will be required to sell the security before its anticipated recovery.&#160;&#160;If either of the conditions in (6)&#160;are met, the Company would recognize an other-than-temporary impairment in earnings equal to the difference between the fair value of the security and its adjusted cost basis.&#160;&#160;If neither of the conditions are met, the Company determines (a)&#160;the amount of credit loss and (b)&#160;the amount of impairment related to other factors.&#160;&#160;The amount of the credit loss would be included in the consolidated statement of operations as other-than-temporary impairment on securities and as an adjustment to the amortized cost basis.&#160;&#160;The portion of the impairment related to other factors is included in other comprehensive income (loss).</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">56</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Federal Home Loan Bank stock:</font>&#160;&#160;The Bank, as a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of Chicago (the FHLB), is required to maintain an investment in capital stock of the FHLB.&#160;&#160;The stock does not have a readily determinable fair value as ownership is restricted and it lacks a ready market.&#160;&#160;As a result, this stock is carried at cost and evaluated periodically for impairment.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The investment in the stock of the FHLB of Chicago is considered a long term investment.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, when evaluating impairment, the value of the FHLB stock is determined by the ultimate recovery of the par value rather than recognizing temporary declines in value.&#160;&#160;The decision of whether impairment exists is a matter of judgment that reflects factors such as operating performance, the severity and duration of declines in the market value of its net assets relative to capital levels, its commitment to make payments in relation to its operating performance, the impact of regulatory and legislative changes, and its liquidity and funding position.&#160;&#160;The Bank has concluded that its investment in the stock of FHLB of Chicago was not impaired at December&#160;31, 2010.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Loans:</font>&#160;&#160;Loans that management has the intent and ability to hold for the foreseeable future or until maturity or payoff are reported at their outstanding unpaid principal balances adjusted for charge-offs, the allowance for loan losses, and any deferred fees or costs on originated loans.&#160;&#160;Interest income is accrued on the unpaid principal balance.&#160;&#160;Loan origination fees, net of certain direct origination costs, are deferred and recognized as an adjustment of the related loan yield using the interest method.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">A loan is considered impaired when, based on current information and events, it is probable that the Company will be unable to collect the scheduled payments of principal or interest when due according to the contractual terms of the loan agreement.&#160;&#160;Factors considered by management in determining the impairment include payment status, collateral value, and the probability of collecting scheduled principal and interest payments when due.&#160;&#160;Loans that experience insignificant payment delays and payment shortfalls generally are not classified as impaired.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Management determines the significance of payment delays and payment shortfalls on a case-by-case basis, taking into consideration all of the circumstances surrounding the loan and the borrower, including the length of the delay, the reasons for the delay, the borrower&#8217;s prior payment record, and the amount of the shortfall in relation to the principal and interest owed.&#160;&#160;Impairment is measured on a loan-by-loan basis by either the fair value of collateral if the loan is collateral dependent, the present value of expected future cash flows discounted at the loan&#8217;s effective interest rate, or the loan&#8217;s obtainable market price.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Residential real estate and consumer loans are collectively evaluated for impairment.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, the Company does not separately identify individual consumer and residential real estate loans for impairment disclosures, unless such loans are the subject of a restructuring agreement.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The accrual of interest is discontinued at the time the loan is 90 days past due unless the credit is well-secured and in process of collection.&#160;&#160;Past due status is based on contractual terms of the loan.&#160;&#160;In all cases, loans are placed on non-accrual or charged-off at an earlier date if collection of principal or interest is considered doubtful.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">All interest accrued but not collected for loans that are placed on non-accrual or charged-off is reversed against interest income.&#160;&#160;The interest on these loans is accounted for on the cash-basis or cost-recovery method until qualifying for return to accrual.&#160;&#160;Loans are returned to accrual status when all the principal and interest amounts contractually due are brought current and future payments are reasonably assured.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Troubled debt restructurings:</font><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">A loan is classified as a troubled debt restructuring when a borrower is experiencing financial difficulties that leads to a restructuring of the loan, and the Company</font></font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">57</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">grants concessions to the borrower in the restructuring that it would not otherwise consider.&#160;&#160;These concessions may include rate reductions, principal forgiveness, extension of maturity date and other actions intended to minimize potential losses.&#160;&#160;A loan that is modified at a market rate of interest may no longer be classified as troubled debt restructuring in the calendar year subsequent to the restructuring if it is in compliance with the modified terms.&#160;&#160;Performance prior to the restructuring is considered when assessing whether the borrower can meet the new terms and may result in the loan being returned to accrual at the time of the restructuring or after a shorter performance period.</font></font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Allowance for loan losses:</font><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">The allowance for loan losses is established through a provision for loan losses charged to expense.&#160;&#160;Loans are charged against the allowance for loan losses when management believes that collectibility of the principal is unlikely.&#160;&#160;The allowance is an amount that management believes will be adequate to absorb probable and estimable losses inherent in the loan portfolio and is based on the size and current risk characteristics of the loan portfolio; an assessment of individual problem loans; actual and anticipated loss experience; and current economic events.&#160;&#160;These economic events include unemployment levels, regulatory guidance, and general economic conditions.&#160;&#160;Determination of the allowance for loan losses is inherently subjective as it requires significant estimates, including amounts and timing of expected future cash flows on impaired loans, valuation of collateral on impaired loans, historical loss experience, and consideration of economic trends which may be susceptible to significant change.&#160;&#160;In addition, regulatory agencies, as an integral part of their examination process, periodically review the Bank&#8217;s allowance for loan losses, and may require it to recognize adjustments to its allowance based on their judgments of information available to them at the time of their examinations.</font></font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">When establishing the allowance for loan losses, management categorizes loans into risk categories generally based on the nature of the collateral and the basis of repayment.&#160;&#160;These risk categories and the relevant risk characteristics are as follows:</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Commercial and industrial loans</font> &#8211; Commercial loans are loans for commercial, corporate and business purposes, including issuing letters of credit.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s commercial business loan portfolio is comprised of loans for a variety of purposes and generally is secured by equipment, machinery and other business assets.&#160;&#160;Commercial business loans generally have terms of five years or less and interest rates that float in accordance with a designated published index.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Real estate - Construction loans</font> &#8211; Construction real estate loans consist of vacant land and property that is in the process of improvement.&#160;&#160;Repayment of these loans can be dependent on the sale of the property to third parties or the successful completion of the improvements by the builder for the end user.&#160;&#160;Construction loans also run the risk that improvements will not be completed on time or in accordance with specifications and projected costs.&#160;&#160;Construction real estate loans generally have terms of one year to eighteen months during the construction period and interest rates based on a designated index.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Real estate - Mortgage loans</font> &#8211; Mortgage loans are primarily secured by commercial real estate, multifamily dwellings, and both owner occupied and non-owner occupied 1-4 family homes.&#160;&#160;Specific terms vary based on the nature of the loan, but amortizations are generally over 5-30 years.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Loans to individuals</font> &#8211; Loans to individuals generally have higher interest rates than mortgage loans.&#160;&#160;The risk involved in consumer loans is the type and nature of the collateral and, in certain cases, the absence of collateral.&#160;&#160;Consumer loans include vehicle loans and other secured and unsecured loans that have been made for a variety of consumer purposes.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">The allowance for loan losses is comprised of two elements:&#160;&#160;a general loss exposure element and a specific reserve element for impaired loans.&#160;&#160;Each element is discussed below.</font></font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">58</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">General loss exposure element</font><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline"> &#8211; The Company maintains a general loan loss exposure amount for the four categories of loans in the portfolio - commercial loans, real estate loans, construction real estate loans and consumer loans.&#160;&#160;The Company uses a loan loss reserve model that incorporates historical losses over a multi-year period.&#160;&#160;Under the loan risk rating system, each loan, with the exception of those included in large groups of smaller-balance homogeneous loans, is risk rated between one and nine by the originating loan officer, credit management, loan review or loan committee.&#160;&#160;Loans rated one represent those loans least likely to default and a loan rated nine represents a loss.&#160;&#160;Loan balances are multiplied by a historical loss factor for each loan type (which incorporates estimated recoveries) to determine an appropriate level of allowance by loan type.</font></font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">The general loan loss exposure amount also includes estimated losses resulting from macroeconomic factors.&#160;&#160;Macroeconomic factors adjust the allowance for loan losses upward or downward based on the current point in the economic cycle and are applied to the loan loss model through a separate allowance element for the commercial loans, real estate loans, construction real estate loans and consumer loan components.&#160;&#160;The Company periodically reviews the factors in order to conclude they are adequate based on current economic conditions.</font></font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">For loans collateralized by real estate, t</font>he Bank also looks at the value of underlying collateral and, for any valuation older than six months, the Bank makes an adjustment to the value based on regional housing price indexes.&#160;&#160;The Bank considers loans with adjusted loan to value ratios below 60% a negative qualitative factor based on the Bank&#8217;s loss history with low loan-to-value loans.&#160;&#160;<font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">Estimated loan default factors are multiplied by these balances and deducted from </font>the required general loan loss reserve.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">Pools of homogeneous loans with similar risk and loss characteristics are also assessed for probable losses.&#160;&#160;These loan pools consist primarily of the Bank&#8217;s consumer loans.&#160;&#160;Loan balances are multiplied by a historical loss factor.</font></font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Specific reserves element</font><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline"> &#8211; The allowance for loan losses also includes specific reserves on impaired loans.&#160;&#160;A loan is considered to be impaired when management believes, after considering collection efforts and other factors, the borrower&#8217;s financial condition is such that the collection of all contractual principal and interest payments due is doubtful.</font></font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">At each quarter-end, impaired loans are reviewed individually, with adjustments made to the calculated reserve for each loan as deemed necessary.&#160;&#160;Specific adjustments are made depending on expected cash flows and/or the value of the collateral securing each loan.&#160;&#160;The Company obtains a current external appraisal (within 12 months) on real estate related impaired loans and other valuation techniques are used as well, including internal valuations, comparable property analyses and contractual sales information.&#160;&#160;For appraisals that are more than six months old, the Company may further discount appraisal values.&#160;&#160;This discount is based on an evaluation of market conditions and is in addition to a reduction in value for potential sales costs and discounting that has been incorporated in the independent appraisal.</font></font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Transfers of financial assets:</font>&#160;&#160;Transfers of financial assets are accounted for as sales when control over the assets has been surrendered.&#160;&#160;Control over transferred assets is deemed to be surrendered when (1)&#160;the assets have been isolated from the Company, (2)&#160;the transferee obtains the right (free of conditions that constrain it from taking advantage of that right) to pledge or exchange the transferred assets, and (3)&#160;the Company does not maintain effective control over the transferred assets through an agreement to repurchase them before their maturity.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Premises and equipment:</font>&#160;&#160;Land is carried at cost.&#160;&#160;Premises and equipment are stated at cost less accumulated depreciation.&#160;&#160;Depreciation is computed over the assets&#8217; useful lives using the straight-line method.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">59</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Other real estate owned: </font><font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline">Real estate acquired through foreclosure or deed in lieu of foreclosure represents specific assets to which the Bank has acquired legal title in satisfaction of indebtedness.&#160;&#160;Such real estate is initially recorded at the property&#8217;s fair value at the date of foreclosure less estimated selling costs.&#160;&#160;Initial valuation adjustments, if any, are charged against the allowance for loan losses.&#160;&#160;Property is evaluated regularly to ensure the recorded amount is supported by its current fair value.&#160;&#160;Subsequent declines in estimated fair value are charged to expense when incurred.&#160;&#160;Revenues and expenses related to holding and operating these properties are included in operations.</font></font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Goodwill:</font>&#160;&#160;Goodwill represents the excess of cost over fair value of net assets acquired which arose in the acquisition of Community Bank of Lawndale during March&#160;2008.&#160;&#160;Goodwill is not amortized but is tested at least annually for impairment.&#160;&#160;In 2009, the Company determined goodwill was fully impaired, which resulted in a charge of $1,186,000.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Intangible assets:</font>&#160;&#160;Intangible assets consist of core deposit intangibles obtained in the acquisition of Community Bank of Lawndale during March&#160;2008.&#160;&#160;Core deposit intangibles (the portion of an acquisition purchase price which represents value assigned to the existing deposit base) have finite lives and are amortized over seven years.&#160;&#160;These are evaluated for impairment on an annual basis.&#160;&#160;No impairment has been necessary in any year related to these intangible assets.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Prepaid FDIC insurance assessment:</font>&#160;&#160;The prepaid FDIC insurance assessment represents the prepayment during December&#160;2009 of the Company&#8217;s projected assessments for 2010, 2011 and 2012.&#160;&#160;The Company recognizes this as FDIC insurance assessment expense as it is incurred.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Income taxes:</font>&#160;&#160;Deferred taxes are provided using the liability method.&#160;&#160;Deferred tax assets are recognized for deductible temporary differences and operating loss and tax credit carryforwards and deferred tax liabilities are recognized for taxable temporary differences.&#160;&#160;Temporary differences are the differences between the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and their tax basis.&#160;&#160;Deferred tax assets are reduced by a valuation allowance when, in the opinion of management, it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will not be realized.&#160;&#160;Deferred tax assets and liabilities are adjusted for the effects of changes in tax laws and rates on the date of enactment.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">When tax returns are filed, it is highly certain that some positions taken would be sustained upon examination by the taxing authorities, while others are subject to uncertainty about the merits of the position taken or the amounts of the position that would be ultimately sustained.&#160;&#160;The benefit of a tax position is recognized in the financial statements in the period during which, based on all available evidence, management believes it is more likely than not that the position will be sustained upon examination, including the resolution of appeals or litigation processes, if any.&#160;&#160;Tax positions are not offset or aggregated with other tax positions.&#160;&#160;Tax positions that meet the more-likely-than-not recognition threshold are measured as the largest amount of tax benefit that is more than 50 percent likely of being realized upon settlement with the applicable taxing authority.&#160;&#160;The portion of the benefits associated with tax positions taken that exceeds the amount measured as described above is reflected as a liability for unrecognized tax benefits in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets along with any associated interest and penalties that would be payable to the taxing authorities upon examination.&#160;&#160;It is the Company&#8217;s policy that interest and penalties associated with unrecognized tax benefits are classified as interest expense in the consolidated statements of operations.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">There were no uncertain tax positions for which a liability has been recorded at December&#160;31, 2010.&#160;&#160;Income tax returns for years 2008 through 2010, with few exceptions, remain open to examinations by federal and state taxing authorities.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Bank Enterprise Award grant:</font>&#160;&#160;The Bank Enterprise Award grant is awarded by the U.S. Department of Treasury&#8217;s Community Development Financial Institutions (CDFI) Fund to FDIC-insured</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">60</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">banks and thrifts for their community and economic development lending activity.&#160;&#160;The award is based on lending activity from the previous year.&#160;&#160;The Bank records the grant income upon receipt.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Comprehensive income:</font>&#160;&#160;Accounting principles require that recognized revenue, expenses, gains and losses be included in net income.&#160;&#160;Although certain changes in assets and liabilities, such as unrealized gains and losses on available for sale securities, net of deferred taxes, are reported as a separate component of the equity section of the balance sheet, such items, along with net income, are components of comprehensive income.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Earnings (losses) per common share:</font>&#160;&#160;Basic earnings (losses) per share represents net income (loss) available to common stockholders divided by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding.&#160;&#160;Diluted earnings per share reflect additional common shares that would have been outstanding if dilutive potential common shares had been issued.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Fair value: </font>The accounting standards define fair value, establish a framework for measuring fair value and expand disclosures about fair value measurement.&#160;&#160;Fair value is a market-based measurement, not an entity-specific measurement, and the hierarchy gives the highest priority to quoted prices in active markets.&#160;&#160;Fair value measurements are disclosed by level within the fair value hierarchy.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Segment reporting:</font>&#160;&#160;Management views the Company as one operating segment, therefore, separate reporting of financial segment information is not considered necessary.&#160;&#160;Management approaches the Company as one business enterprise which operates in a single economic environment since the products and services, types of customers and regulatory environment all have similar characteristics.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Recent accounting pronouncements:</font>&#160;&#160;The following accounting standards were recently issued relating to the financial services industry:</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">In June&#160;2009, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) issued new guidance relating to the accounting for transfers of financial assets.&#160;&#160;The new guidance, which was issued as SFAS No.&#160;166, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Accounting for Transfers of Financial Assets, an amendment to SFAS No.&#160;140</font>, was adopted into Codification in December&#160;2009 through the issuance of Accounting Standards Update (ASU) 2009-16, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Transfers and Servicing (Topic 860):&#160;&#160;Accounting for Transfers of Financial Assets</font>.&#160;&#160;Among other provisions, this ASU eliminates the concept of a &#8220;qualifying special-purpose entity&#8221; and removes the exception from applying certain accounting guidance to qualifying special-purpose entities.&#160;&#160;In addition, this ASU provides guidance as to when a portion of a transferred financial asset can be evaluated for sale accounting, provides additional guidance with regard to accounting for transfers of financial assets and requires additional disclosures.&#160;&#160;ASU 2009-16 was effective at the beginning of a reporting entity&#8217;s first fiscal year that begins after November&#160;15, 2009.&#160;&#160;The adoption of this guidance did not have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">In January&#160;2010, the FASB issued ASU 2010-06, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures (Topic 820):&#160;&#160;Improving Disclosures about Fair Value Measurements</font>.&#160;&#160;ASU 2010-06 requires new disclosures on transfers into an out of Level 1 and 2 measurements of the fair value hierarchy and requires separate disclosures about purchases, sales, issuances, and settlements relating to the level of disaggregation and inputs and valuation techniques used to measure fair value.&#160;&#160;It is effective for the first reporting period (including interim periods) beginning after December&#160;15, 2009, except for the requirement to provide the Lever 3 activity of purchase, sales, issuances, and settlements on a gross basis, which will be effective for fiscal years beginning after December&#160;15, 2010.&#160;&#160;The adoption of this pronouncement related to Level 1 and 2 measurements did not have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.&#160;&#160;The adoption of this pronouncement related to Level 3 measurements is not expected to have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">61</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">In July&#160;2010, the FASB issued ASU 2010-20, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Receivables (Topic 310):&#160;&#160;Disclosures about the Credit Quality of Financing Receivables and the Allowance for Credit Losses</font>.&#160;&#160;ASU 2010-20 requires new disclosures that facilitate financial statement users&#8217; evaluation of the following:&#160;&#160;(1)&#160;the nature of credit risk inherent in the entity&#8217;s portfolio of financing receivables; (2)&#160;how that risk is analyzed and assessed in arriving at the allowance for credit losses; and (3)&#160;the changes and reasons for those changes in the allowance for credit losses.&#160;&#160;The disclosures as of the end of a reporting period are effective for interim and annual reporting periods ending on or after December&#160;15, 2010.&#160;&#160;The disclosures about activity that occurs during a reporting period are effective for interim and annual reporting periods beginning on or after December&#160;15, 2010.&#160;&#160;The adoption of this guidance significantly expanded existing disclosure requirements but did not and will not have an impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows.&#160;&#160;The Company will adopt the disclosures provisions related to loans modified in a troubled debt restructuring on July&#160;1, 2011.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">In April&#160;2011, the FASB issued ASU 2011-02, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">A Creditor&#8217;s Determination of Whether a Restructuring Is a Troubled Debt Restructuring.&#160;&#160;</font>ASU 2011-02 amends ASC Topic 310, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Receivables, </font>by clarifying guidance for creditors in determining whether a concession has been granted and whether a debtor is experiencing financial difficulties.&#160;&#160;ASU 2011-2 is effective for annual periods ending on or after December&#160;15, 2012, and is not expected to have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">In April&#160;2011, the FASB issued ASU 2011-03, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Transfers and Servicing (Topic 860) </font>- <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Reconsideration </font>of <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Effective Control for Repurchase Agreements.&#160;&#160;</font>ASU 2011-03 is intended to improve financial reporting of repurchase agreements and other agreements that both entitle and obligate a transferor to repurchase or redeem financial assets before their maturity.&#160;&#160;ASU 2011-03 removes from the assessments of effective control (i)&#160;the criterion requiring the transferor to have the ability to repurchase or redeem the financial assets on substantially the agreed terms, even in the event of default by the transferee and (ii)&#160;the collateral maintenance guidance related to that criterion.&#160;&#160;ASU 2011-03 is effective for the Company on January&#160;1, 2012, and is not expected to have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">In May&#160;2011, the FASB issued ASU 2011-02, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Fair Value Measurement (Topic 820) Amendments to Achieve Common Fair Value Measurements and Disclosure Requirements in U.S. GAAP and IFRS</font>. ASU 2011-04 amends ASC Topic 820, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures</font>, to converge the fair value measurement guidance in U.S. generally accepted accounting principles and International Financial Reporting Standards.&#160;&#160;ASU 2011-04 clarifies the application of existing fair value measurement requirements, changes certain principles in Topic 820 and requires additional fair value disclosures.&#160;&#160;ASU 2011-04 is effective for annual periods beginning after December&#160;15, 2011, and the adoption is not expected to have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">In June&#160;2011, the FASB issued ASU 2011-05, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Comprehensive Income (Topic 220) </font>- <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Presentation of Comprehensive Income.&#160;&#160;</font>ASU 2011-05 amends Topic 220, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Comprehensive Income, </font>to require that all non-owner changes in stockholders&#8217; equity be presented in either a single continuous statement of comprehensive income or in two separate but consecutive statements.&#160;&#160;The amendments do not change the items that must be reported in other comprehensive income or when an item of other comprehensive income must be reclassified to net income.&#160;&#160;Additionally, ASU 2011-05 requires entities to present, on the face of the financial statements, reclassification adjustments for items that are reclassified from other comprehensive income to net income in the statement or statements where the components of net income and the components of other comprehensive income are presented.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The option to present components of other comprehensive income as part of the statement of changes in stockholders&#8217; equity was eliminated.&#160;&#160;ASU 2011-05 is effective for annual periods beginning</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">62</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt"><a href="#TOC">Table of Contents</a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">after December&#160;15, 2012, and is not expected to have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.&#160;&#160;In December&#160;2011, the FASB issued ASU 2011-12, <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Comprehensive Income (Topic 220) </font>- <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Deferral of the Effective Date for Amendments to the Presentation of Reclassifications of Items Out of Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income in ASU No.&#160;2011-05.&#160;&#160;</font>ASU 2011-12 defers the specific requirement to present items that are reclassified from accumulated other comprehensive income to net income separately with their respective components of net income and other comprehensive income.&#160;&#160;This standard does not defer the requirement to report comprehensive income either in a single continuous statement or in two separate but consecutive financial statements.&#160;&#160;While the FASB is considering the operational concerns about the presentation requirements for classification adjustments, entities will continue to report reclassifications out of accumulated comprehensive income consistent with the presentation requirements in effect before ASU 2011-05.&#160;&#160;ASU 2011-12 is effective for the Company concurrent with ASU 2011-05.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Reclassifications:</font>&#160;&#160;Certain reclassifications have been made to balances, with no effect on net income (loss) or total stockholders&#8217; equity, as of and for the year ended December&#160;31, 2009, to be consistent with the classifications adopted as of and for the year ended December&#160;31, 2010.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Note 2.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Regulatory Actions and Management&#8217;s Plans</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">In June&#160;2011, the Bank agreed to a Consent Order issued by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (the FDIC) and the Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation (the IDFPR).&#160;&#160;The Consent Order contains Articles that address issues ranging from a capital directive, which requires the Bank to achieve and maintain minimum regulatory capital levels (in excess of the statutory minimums to be classified as well-capitalized) to developing a Liquidity plan.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">While the Company intends to take such actions as may be necessary to enable the Bank to comply with the Articles, there can be no assurance the Bank will be able to comply fully with those Articles, or that compliance with the Regulatory Agreements, particularly the regulatory capital requirements, will not have material and adverse effects on the operations and financial condition of the Company and the Bank.&#160;&#160;Any material failure to comply with the provisions of the Consent Order could result in further enforcement actions by both the FDIC and the IDFPR, or the placing of the Bank into conservatorship or receivership.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Consent Order with the FDIC and IDFPR restricts the payment of dividends or any other payment representing a reduction in capital from the Bank, without the prior approval of the FDIC.&#160;&#160;The Consent Order also requires the Bank to develop a capital plan by July&#160;30, 2011, which shall address, among other things, the Bank&#8217;s current and future capital requirements, compliance with minimum capital ratios and the source and timing of additional funds necessary to meet future capital requirements.&#160;&#160;Notice would be required regarding the appointment of any new director or senior executive officer.&#160;&#160;Finally, the Board of Directors of the Company is required to submit written progress reports to the FDIC within 30 days after the end of each fiscal quarter.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Consent Order with the FDIC and the IDFPR requires the Bank, among other things:</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25;">
<td style="WIDTH: 57.6pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">to establish a compliance committee to monitor and coordinate compliance with the Consent Order;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25;">

</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">to achieve and maintain Tier 1 capital at least equal to 9% of adjusted total assets and at least equal to 13% of risk-weighted assets by July&#160;30, 2011;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25;">
<td style="WIDTH: 57.6pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">to develop a profit plan for the Bank by July&#160;30, 2011, which shall, among other things, include specific plans for maintaining adequate capital</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">to revise by July&#160;30, 2011, a liquidity risk management program, which assesses, on an ongoing basis, the Bank&#8217;s current and projected funding needs, and ensures that sufficient funds exist to meet those needs;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25;">

</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">to revise by July&#160;30, 2011, the Bank&#8217;s loan policy and commercial real estate concentration management program.&#160;&#160;The Bank also must establish a new loan review program to ensure the timely and independent identification of problem loans and modify its existing program for the maintenance of an adequate allowance for loan and lease losses; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25;">
<td style="WIDTH: 57.6pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">to revise by July&#160;30, 2011, a plan to protect the Bank&#8217;s interest in certain assets identified by the FDIC and IDFPR or any other bank examiner.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Note 3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Business Combinations</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">On March&#160;12, 2008, the Company acquired all of the outstanding common stock of Community Bank of Lawndale, a $34 million bank headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, which was funded through the issuance of common stock.&#160;&#160;The transaction has been accounted for as a purchase and the results of operations since the acquisition date have been included in the consolidated financial statements.&#160;&#160;The purchase price of $2,892,000 was allocated based upon the fair value of the assets acquired and liabilities assumed.&#160;&#160;The excess of the total acquisition cost over the fair value of the net tangible assets acquired has been allocated to core deposit intangible with the remaining residual recorded as goodwill.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Subsequent to the acquisition, the name of the bank was changed to Covenant Bank.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Note 4.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Cash and Due from Banks</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Bank is required to maintain balances on hand with the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago.&#160;&#160;At December&#160;31, 2010 and 2009, these balances amounted to approximately $50,000.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The nature of the Bank&#8217;s business requires that it maintain amounts due from banks, federal funds sold and interest-bearing deposits in banks which, at times, may exceed federally insured limits.&#160;&#160;Management monitors these correspondent relationships and the Bank has not experienced any losses in such accounts.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Note 5.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Securities</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The amortized cost and fair value of securities available for sale and the related gross unrealized gains and losses, follows (in thousands):</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div align="left">

</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">There were no securities held to maturity at December&#160;31, 2010.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Securities with a fair value of approximately $2,150,000 and $602,000 were pledged as collateral on public funds and for other purposes as required or permitted by law as of December&#160;31, 2010 and 2009, respectively.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">There was $57,000 in gross realized gains on the sales of securities during the year ended December&#160;31, 2010.&#160;&#160;There were no gross realized gains or losses on the sales of securities during the year ended December&#160;31, 2009, and the period from inception (March&#160;12, 2008) to December&#160;31, 2008.</font></div>

<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<td align="left" valign="bottom" width="76%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">
